title: #ChampFeelMatters
body:
Dear Riot Scruffy I am asking that you don't put the new Sylas changes into live next week, not because they are all bad, but because it will basically kill the champion and ruin the experience for a lot of the Sylas mains and players out there. Simply put the changes to his kit will make his numbers look better on paper but make his game play feel slow and clunky, like we aren't even playing the same champion. We aren't asking for much, just that you reconsider these changes and hold off on them until further testing is done to be able to make some good changes while keeping his game play the same fluid fun one that a lot of players fell in love with. Sylas is one of the few champs in the game that makes it fun for us. Please don't take that away.  

Comment #ChampFeelMatters and your thoughts and suggestions in the chat if you agree and maybe they will listen to the community and tread more carefully in the future when making similar decisions with not just Sylas but other champions that need balancing. Thank you for reading!

Please, if a rioter is reading this, consider the approach of changing sylas. Please don't make him a statcheck. Currently he is a multidimensional champion and most of us Sylasplayers don't like where these changes are heading. 

The changes he has recieved on the PBE push him into an assassin playstyle, where he may oneshot someone by hitting E2 and W (+Lichbane AA) on his target before using zonyas and repeating the whole process. I agree that the removal of the shild would make that playstyle less tilting for the enemy player.

In my opinion though you could just not remove his skillexpression and add some damage onto his onhit passive (not the AOE portion) and remove the damagebuff from his E2 and the shild from his E1. Perhaps make his AD ults scale a tiny bit better as it used to; his anti-mage identity I can't support (most demacian champions do physical damage anyways) and there is the question to why not just pick kassadin at that point?

People keep using this quote out of context. The "A Dev doesn't need to play the game in order to balance it", was used comparatively to talk about how just because a Pro Player is really good at the game, does not mean that they'd also be the best at balancing the game. That was never Ghostcrawler saying "You shouldn't play the game while balancing it", it was disputing a point that Pro-players would know how to fix things.

#ChampFeelMatters

To be fair, he is probably the champ with the most mechanics in 1 kit (after aphelios now? idk)

He has a shield, heal, 2 dashes (1 conditional), execute damage, 2 kinds of aoe, knock-up, slow
and his R makes him even more of a generalist.

It's not that I find it great to remove mechanics from champions, but newer ones just get more and more things pressed into 4 abilities and a passive, that at some point they have to lose something.
Aatrox, Akali, Yuumi, Irelia, Zoe, now Sylas and I wouldn't be surprised if Senna and Aphelios follow soon. They all lost quite a lot of things in their kit to make them less oppressive over all other champions.

What I'm trying to say is, he is such a generalist, that in his current form he has to have weak numbers or is just broken otherwise. They approach it exactly from that perspective, buff him in numbers but take away what makes him problematic.

Camille has two dashes, a true-damage nuke, 2 auto attack resets, AOE and magical % health damage, healing, a health-scaling shield, a stun, a movement speed and attack speed steroid and an AOE slow. And she's one of the best-balanced champions in the game who almost never needs balance changes (there was her release and a brief time where she was too good in the jungle but that was only very brief and didn't need much to nerf her out of it).
The problem is that they don't seem to know where they want Sylas to be. They need to decide on whether he needs to be a bruiser or an assassin and balance him for it: right now he's a bit of both and it's hurting his balance and champ identity.
Is he a bruiser? If so, why does he build full AP and not AP-tank like Swain? Where is his health scaling and % health damage?
Is he an assassin? If so why does he have a burst heal? Why doesn't he have an escape? How is his ult supposed to benefit an assassin playstyle?

What needs to be done is Riot needs to put their foot down and say "This champion is a bruiser like Camille or Vi and we're going to tune his numbers like one" and give him low-damage, short-cooldown abilities with a mixture of AP and health scaling so ROA becomes an attractive first option like Swain or Diana. Then, and only then, will they sort Sylas out.
I always thought Sylas was supposed to be built off-tank so he could survive in a fight longer.

In an ideal world he would be, but there's absolutely no reason within his kit for him to build anything but AP. His dependence on 40% CDR pushes you towards building Luden's Echo since it gives you so much CDR, and his heal and shield both scale with AP and nothing else. 

That's probably the single biggest reason Sylas has been impossible to balance: because the rewards for him building full AP are too good and the rewards for him building AP-tank are too bad. 

If Sylas was balanced like a bruiser and had a reason in his kit to build health (e.g. his heal or shield scaling with bonus health) we probably wouldn't be in this mess, but the obstinate refusal of Riot to entertain abandoning an assassin playstyle in favour of a bruiser-y one means that isn't happening.

He's definitely not the champ with the most mechanics in one kit. As for his balance, I think they should focus more on the reliability/power of his base kit. To me, I've always felt that a champion can have a lot in their kit, but if those tools need to be gated in some way so it's fair to play against. Camille is a great example or ekko (before the spam buffs this season). Putting his shield on hitting his e was a really nice change and I'm not sure why they removed it. Another possible change would be to remove the slow from Q1 and keeping it on Q2.

He has a similar issue to {{champion:429}} . He has a really easy to use kit that allows a lot of burst or DPS. That along with his current shield and W sustain. Late game he is a monster. the last nerf to his ult and the moving of his shield (again) is them trying to give him SOME weakness. But like kalista. It is either insanely weak or insanely broken. (look at ryze. they have tried retaining his kit for so long and it is still insanely hard to balance).  

Yuumi is kind of the same but Unholy Grail is what makes her insanely broke.

Agreed. Please, Riot, reconsider those changes.
They're not all bad, but Sylas will never be the same. The problem is not in numbers or shield removal, the problem is **_the champion is not fun to play anymore_**. Just like Kalista or Yuumi. We fell in love with his mechanics, they are what makes Sylas being Sylas.
It's so sad that rework is going to make all the hours spent by lots players to learn him pointless.

Playing him will kinda be like playing Irelia or something, use all your abilities then auto them to death . I think it's a decent change but it feels like garbage to play.

How do they want Sylas to be played in the midlane while also removing the shield which is his only tool against mages to survive the lane properly ?

Also adding 5 more charges to his passive will not help him to clear the waves, just buff the base damage on nearby enemies because it actually feels so useless.

To be honest, this could have all been avoided. Sylas did not need to be the way he is. He should have been worked on more. Maybe he could have been seen as balanced if some one else was in charge of the game. I don't put any real blame on his players or even the pros. Riot should know by now what a champion will do in pro play, I mean this has been their only game for so long it's only natural that the one with all the data and access to player opinions on the boards worldwide would know.

First off, they jumped the gun and did tons of fucking changes to him because he was problematic (not because of the kit, it was Aftershock and it took them forever to notice it was Aftershock), so they sunk resources into pointless work, which already started ruining him, so they did more, and then more, and then more. Man, its almost like this is the same shit that has KILLED the Aatrox rework currently, and since Riot's too busy being mage biased, means Sylas will likely end up like Aatrox regardless if we ask them to stop or not.

Keep the passive change, but:
A- Make the primary auto still deal phys on top of the aoe damage
B- re-rig the auto animation to alternate between left swing and right swing
C- give him either better attack speed base , or give him what taric has for his passive.

When creating anything for pro play, if Riot creates a champion specifically and specially tailored to pro play in any role and gives then overloaded or kits only good for being flashy it hurts the playerbase. I wish you guys would stop taking hits like this because it sucks to see your favorite champion be taken away from you. Was {{champion:136}} old W strong and a toxic permaslow with {{item:3116}}? Maybe, but he has clear weaknesses that were so exploitable by his counters it felt so unfair at times. I've gotten used to the new W, but I played him long enough to appreciate what the champion has lost. I can't say that for someone like Aatrox who I did not even know much about until he got reworked. I was surprised he came out so different but I never picked up the champion, old or new.
Honestly, when making a new champ, design should be about how they feel to play and play against. Numbers can come afterwards, because what's more important is everyone having fun.
What made people care now cause I remember when people said this during the assassin rework this was considered alright for the sake of balance.

This seems to be a Galio situation all over again tbh. High base damages, high scalings, and alot of built in defense (the hp changes alone put him at the highest base hp in the game at level 18, a whopping 2480, which was previously held by Galio at 2466). Of course, I don't play sylas and part of the hp increase is probably to counteract the loss of the shield, but those numbers are kinda nuts.

He just totally lacks role identity. He's got the kit of a bruiser (the heal and shield) but the numbers of an assassin (lots of AP scaling, reliance on CDR-heavy burst mage items like Luden's and no % health damage or defensive health scaling). What he needs is to be firmly ensconced in the bruiser role with a kit of low-cooldown, low-individual impact abilities like Riven that synergise with his passive to make him less reliant on 40% CDR so that ROA will be an attractive first item like Diana or Swain, with a mixture of AP, level and health scalings to make sure he gets rewarded for building AP-tank and not for building full AP.
